musicalLanguage.description: Elton John's breakthrough — a piano ballad that proved rock could be tender. Written when he was 22, it's a masterclass in how a simple chord progression and sincere melody can be more powerful than any virtuoso display. The piano IS the band.
musicalLanguage.structure: Intro - Verse 1 - Verse 2 - Chorus - Verse 3 - Verse 4 - Chorus - Outro
keyMoments: The opening Eb major chord: warm, open, inviting
The Cm shift at 'If I was a sculptor': the first emotional turn
The chorus build on 'I hope you don't mind': where the song opens up and soars
teachingGoals: Chord inversions for smooth voice leading
Playing and singing simultaneously — keeping the piano independent
styleTips: Keep the left hand steady — simple bass notes or octaves
The right hand should flow, not plod — connect the chords
Build through each verse, don't play verse 4 like verse 1
This is a love letter, not a performance — play it honestly
